fact_check_explanation_title: What do lockdown restrictions mean for relationships around the UK?
fact_check_explanation_summary: Readers have asked Full Fact to explain how lockdown rules impact their relationships.

fact_check_explanation_title: Royal Navy sailors died while preventing the slave trade, but not tens of thousands
fact_check_explanation_summary: Modern and contemporary records of naval deaths are in the low thousands.

fact_check_explanation_title: There almost certainly aren’t as many as two million unauthorised immigrants in the UK
fact_check_explanation_summary: A recent estimate put the figure between 800,000 and 1.2 million.

fact_check_explanation_title: Andy Burnham was wrong about furlough on Question Time
fact_check_explanation_summary: The Mayor of Greater Manchester suggested that staff in closed pubs and bars in Bolton had no access to support.

fact_check_explanation_title: Flu and Covid-19 statistics are being published in one report, but not added together
fact_check_explanation_summary: They will both now appear in the same weekly document.

fact_check_explanation_title: Flu and Covid-19 statistics are not being added together
fact_check_explanation_summary: It’s just that they are both now published in the same weekly document.

fact_check_explanation_title: It's not true that data on causes of death isn't published
fact_check_explanation_summary: Acclaimed author Frederick Forsyth claimed incorrectly that the ONS doesn’t show where Covid-19 ranks among all causes of death.

fact_check_explanation_title: This comparison of the cost of the Irish and UK contact tracing systems is misleading
fact_check_explanation_summary: The Irish system will cost €700 million for the first year, not £773,000 which is just the cost of developing the app.

fact_check_explanation_title: How to spot misleading images online
fact_check_explanation_summary: Here are examples of image-based misinformation we’ve encountered in our work, and advice on how to verify things you may encounter every day.

fact_check_explanation_title: Shamima Begum is not back in the UK
fact_check_explanation_summary: This claim regularly reappears and has always been false.

fact_check_explanation_title: This viral post on benefits and tax avoidance is inaccurate
fact_check_explanation_summary: It underestimates the spending on benefits for people seeking asylum and uses a disputed estimate of the tax gap to talk about tax avoidance.

fact_check_explanation_title: What did Rishi Sunak actually say about people in the arts?
fact_check_explanation_summary: ITV claimed the Chancellor suggested that people working in the arts sector should retrain and find other jobs.
